sourceMeaningMnemonic: If your <radical>fingers</radical> are strong enough, you can take an <radical>axe</radical> and <kanji>fold</kanji> it in half. But be careful not to <kanji>bend</kanji> it too far, or you might just <kanji>break</kanji> it!
meaningInfo: Imagine holding an axe between your fingers and folding it like a pretzel. Or some silly putty. Or a really soft axe.
readingMnemonic: Unfortunately, as you <kanji>fold</kanji> these axes in half you realize they come in <reading>sets</reading> (<ja>せつ</ja>), so there are twice the axes you thought there would be. To compensate, you start folding them in sets too.
readingInfo: How many axes can you bend at once? A set of two? What about a set of four? Or a set of forty-two?
